definition: A natural occurrence characterized by a large volume of water rapidly covering an area that is normally dry, often caused by heavy rainfall or the overflow of a body of water. It is commonly used to describe a catastrophic event that can result in significant damage to property and infrastructure, as well as pose a threat to human life.

examples.german: Die Flut hat das Dorf überschwemmt.
examples.english: The flood has flooded the village.

examples.german: Die Flutwelle traf die Küste mit großer Wucht.
examples.english: The tidal wave hit the coast with great force.

examples.german: Die Flut des Verkehrs verursachte Staus.
examples.english: The flood of traffic caused congestion.

examples.german: Die Flut der Informationen kann überwältigend sein.
examples.english: The flood of information can be overwhelming.
